result.execSummary:
The defendant Jamie L. Haasch was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Endanger Safety/Use/Dangerous Weapon, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(a).
  • Intentionally Point Firearm At Person, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(c).
  • Operate Firearm While Intoxicated, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 941.20(1)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

The Court sentences the Defendant to 60 days jail, with Huber privileges, to commence 2/19/16 at 6:00pm

--Defendant is required to report for commencement and service of jail sentence with absolute sobriety and without non-prescribed controlled substances in his/her system.  Non-compliance will result in loss of Huber/work-release privileges without further process.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jamie L. Haasch

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Case called at 9:14 am [Clerk SH] (On DOC's Letc. for clarification of Probationary Terms)
Defendant Jamie L. Haasch in court with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer. ADA Theresa A Beck appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Counsel confim they have received coorespondence from DOC
Victim rights compliance verified

ADA Beck reviews 973.09(2)(1a) which she indicates the parties relied upon when making the joint recommendation for 3 years probation, have reviewed statute with Agent and know he has different interpretation of Agent. Do have no objection to changing sentence to 2 years if that is all that is afforded under statute.
Upon questioning of the Court, ADA Beck informs the Court that she has not spoken with any persons at DOJ regarding sentence structure
Court informs parties that DOJ legal counsel was afforded opportunity to appear and has not chosen to appear, but has chosen to have DOC representative stand.

Court finds that Defendant did commit Counts #1, #2, & #3 while possessing a firearm under 973.09(2)(a)1a
Court agrees with analysis by ADA Beck, finds that DOC does not reference in any way possession of firearm in any way and only focused on number of convictions, so 3 years in accurate.
Recess: 9:30 am
Court's Response to DOC letter - Please JA Strike - set this matter for a hearing. Include legal counsel for DOC in the distribution notice
Jefferson County DNA Proof of Submission

Case called at 9:34am [mo]
Defendant Jamie L. Haasch in court with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance; submits a Victim Impact Statement

Sentencing Arguments given by Counsel

On Count #1, the Court sentences the Defendant to 60 days jail, with Huber privileges, to commence 2/19/16 at 6:00pm
----to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge, to be paid by 3/12/2016. Non payment shall result in 8 days in the county jail, with work release/Huber, consecutive to any other sentence. 

On Counts #2, and #3, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 3 years, with conditions as set forth in the Criminal Case Settlement, which are:

--to undergo AODA assessment and follow through with recommended treatment per Agent
--no direct or indirect contact with AJF (dob 11/15/97) or AH (dob 10/2/98)
--to undergo any other assessment, treatment or  counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--to attempt to obtain/maintain employment and/or education program as approved by the Agent
--to submit DNA sample upon demand
--the Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety
--the Defendant shall not be present in any bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--no possession of any dangerous weapons
--On Count #2: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
--On Count #3: to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge

The Court finds that Mr. Haasch is the sole owner of the firearm 
The Court orders the forfeiture and destruction of the Ruber Lc, 9 mm handgun, serial #320-59480, pursuant to 968.20(3) & (4)

The Court orders Mr. Haasch to submit a DNA sample to the Sheriff upon demand
Days credit for time already served:  2  days, to be applied to Count #1

recess: 10:00am

Case called at 8:18am[mo]
[Scheduled for FSSC]
Defendant Jamie L. Haasch in court with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance.

The Court is presented with an Amended Information
--Defense verifies receipt of Amended Information; No objection from the Defense
--The Court grants the State leave for use of the Amended Information

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; pleas of " No Contest " entered on Counts #1, #2, #3 of the Amended Information; factual basis stipulated; the Court accepts pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

recess: 8:34am

NEXT: Sentencing Hearing on 1/29/16 at 8:30am
Proposed STAO for continuance of the 11/20/15 Motion
witness from Dodge Correctional for the 12/10/15 JT
State's notice of intent to admit statements made by the defendant

Case called at 9:54am [mo]
Defendant Jamie L. Haasch in court with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer.   ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.
  
Mr.Haasch  waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered on all counts
recess: 10:05am

NEXT:   (1) Pretrial Conference on 10/28/15 at 10/28/15 at 8:40am (2)FSSC on 12/7/15 at 8:10am (3) Jury Trial on 12/10/15 at 8:30am

Case called at 9:07am [mo]
Defendant Jamie L. Haasch in court with Attorney Joseph Francis Fischer.   ADA Monica Hall appears for the State of Wisconsin.

ADA Hall verifies victim rights compliance

Atty. Fischer gives synopsis of case proceedings, indicates resolution is near.
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling. 
recess: 9:10am

NEXT: Preliminary Hearing(possible plea/sent) on 9/28/15 at 9:00am
DA routing slip requesting PTC be set//after speaking with DA staff the request was recinded
Attorney Josepth Fischer; with Cover Letter
State Public Defender Determination of Financial Eligibility - Defendant not eligible.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Case called at pm [Clerk SH]
Defendant Jamie L. Haasch appears in custody, via video, from the Jefferson County Jailwith Attorney Sylvie Dahnert. Public Service, Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Court finds the proceedings are sight and sound sufficient

Atty Dahnert informs the Court that Mr. Haasch is not eligible for SPD representation
Right to counsel given; constructive waiver of counsel warnings given.
Service of Complaint admitted; dob & address confirmed accurate; reading waived; maximum penalties recited
Preliminary Hearing time limits waived upon agreement of parties 

Court requires a $5000 signature bond, with conditions:
-No possession or consumption of alcohol 
-No presence in bars, taverns or package houses
-No acts or threats of violence
-No contact with AJF or AHH or any of the residents of 811 1/2 S. 6th St. Watertown, WI 
-No presence at 811 1/2 S. 6th St. Watertown, WI
-No possession of dangerous weapons 
Recess: 1:27 pm 

NEXT: (1) DA Pre-trial Conference scheduled for 7/29/15 at 11:00 am - Send notices (2) STC scheduled for at 8/25/15 at 8:30 am - Send notices
